result.execSummary:
The defendant Kari A. Knauf was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: per Judge Bloom - Bond posted in 15cf66 - to be applied to this case -

3:21 p.m. Defendant Kari A. Knauf in court with attorney Mary Margaret Hogan.  Jodie L. Bednar appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Calling 14cf266, 14cf196, 15cf66.  In 14cf266 State moves to amend count 2 to Misdemeanor Bail Jumping  - 946.49(1)(a); in 14cf196 State moves to dismiss Counts 2, 3, 4 but read in for sentencing; in 15cf66 State moves to dismiss all counts but read in for sentencing - Granted. Plea questionaire filed.  Defendant pleads   Court reads on waiver of rights and tendering plea. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that a factual basis for the plea exists and finds defendant guilty. Bednar/Hogan/Court statements to sentencing.
Court Sentence
14cf196
WHS/POP 3 yrs
Jail credit - 1 day
CC/DNA Surcharge/Supervision Fees
Community Service - 100 hours
AODA Assessement
Any other conditions/counseling deemed appropriate by PO
Appeal rights given
14cf266
Counts 1 and 3 - CC to 14cf196
WHS/POP 2yrs
CC/Supervision Fees
AODA Assessment
Community Service - 100 hours
Any other conditions/counseling deemed appropriate by PO
Count 2
Court Costs - $243.00 - to be collected through probation as a courtesy in case 14cf266
Jail - 120 days w/Huber for all purposes to commence on/before Friday, September 11, 2015 at 4:00 p.m.
Appeal rights given
Adj. 3:38 p.m.

2:19 p.m. Defendant Kari A. Knauf in court with attorney Mary Margaret Hogan. Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Also calling 15CF66/14CF196. Hogain in receipt of complaint in 15CF66. Hogan statement-- has been working with Asst. D.A. Bednar-Clemens; makes motion to dismiss/lack of probable cause. Court statement--takes motion to dismiss under advisement. Per Court, no bond required in 15CF66.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 30, 2015 at 02:00 pm.
States Reply to Discovery  and State's Demand for Discovery

03:33 pm - Defendant Kari A. Knauf in court with attorney Mary Margaret Hogan.  Jodie L. Bednar appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Continuance of motion hearing held January 8, 2015.  State recalls RPD Officer Benjamin Curtes/Sworn/Direct by Bednar/Court questions witness/Cross by Hogan.  State calls RPD Officer Kyle Parish/Sworn/Direct by Bednar/Cross by Hogan.  Court denies motion.  In case 14cf266 - Hogan requests pretrial conference for this case as well.  Bail continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 14, 2015 at 02:00 pm.

11:08 am - Defendant Kari A. Knauf in court with attorney Mary Margaret Hogan.  Jodie L. Bednar appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Calling 14cf196 and 14cf266 (Initial).  In case 14cf266 - Hogan only appeared at Initial Appearance.  In case 14cf196 - Motion to Suppress.  State calls RPD Officer Benjamin Curtis/Sworn/Direct by Bednar - State submits to Court Exhibit 1 (Written Warning issued by Officer to Shane Knight)-Rec'd/Cross by Hogan/Court questions witness.  State calls RPD Sgt Angela Mertz/Sworn/Direct by Bednar/Court questions witness/Cross by Hogan.  Hogan recalls RPD Officer Curtis/Remains under oath/Hogan/Court/Bednar questions witness.  Hogan/Bednar statement to motion.  Court requests adjournment until testimony is heard from Officer Parish.  No objection from Bednar/Hogan.  Hogan statement to obtaining copies of recordings from stop - to date, this discovery has not been rec'd.  Pretrial Conference set for January 20, 2015 at 2:00 p.m. is removed from the calendar.  Bail continued.  Motion hearing scheduled for January 29, 2015 at 03:30 pm.

01:34 pm - Attorney Mary Margaret Hogan in court.  Michael Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Signed signature bond indicates an appearance on January 12th.  Underlying case is a BR II case.  Request is the intial appearance be set for January 8th at 11 am.  Court continues signature bond.  Initial appearance scheduled for January 8, 2015 at 11:00 am.
